Glen Eden house fire: Smoke billows across West Auckland as multiple fire crews battle blaze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/glen-eden-house-fire-smoke-billows-across-west-auckland-as-multiple-fire-crews-battle-blaze/EPGRXD2UM5HQPDTTEUYMA6YB2M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/glen-eden-house-fire-smoke-billows-across-west-auckland-as-multiple-fire-crews-battle-blaze/EPGRXD2UM5HQPDTTEUYMA6YB2M/ Police said they have been notified of the blaze but are not attending. Wed, 06 Nov 2024 00:31:14 +0000 Smoke can be seen billowing across Auckland this afternoon as fire crews battle a blaze in Glen Eden. Photo / NZME
Rotorua service station robbed by machete-wielding youths, police allegehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-service-station-robbed-by-machete-wielding-youths-police-allege/P4XXSBRF3BAN5EH5V4LIICDY4I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-service-station-robbed-by-machete-wielding-youths-police-allege/P4XXSBRF3BAN5EH5V4LIICDY4I/ The offenders left in a stolen vehicle which they dumped nearby. Wed, 06 Nov 2024 00:30:27 +0000 Police allege a machete was used in the robbery. Photo / NZ Police
Listen to The Country online: Global Dairy Trade auction with Fonterra chief executive Miles Hurrell https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/listen-to-the-country-online-global-dairy-trade-auction-with-fonterra-chief-executive-miles-hurrell/XZMPNXNNQVF27LNCYY2352U2T4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/listen-to-the-country-online-global-dairy-trade-auction-with-fonterra-chief-executive-miles-hurrell/XZMPNXNNQVF27LNCYY2352U2T4/ Christopher Luxon, Miles Hurrell, Miranda Devine, and Annette O'Sullivan. News, results from around Gisborne and East Coast golf courses https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/sport/news-results-from-around-gisborne-and-east-coast-golf-courses/NCIKZHFI2FDXJJOFPJA63UNHGM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/sport/news-results-from-around-gisborne-and-east-coast-golf-courses/NCIKZHFI2FDXJJOFPJA63UNHGM/ Chris TaewaLocked and loaded for Poverty Bay's men's 19-hole shootout final on Sunday. Wed, 06 Nov 2024 00:23:49 +0000 Roger Bremner (middle) flew the home course flag high at the Fiordland Lobster Company Mahia men's open. Bremner won the overall net competition. He is pictured with men's club captain Grant Hornblow (left) and the Fiordland Lobster Company administrator for the tournament, Denny Hornblow.

Four fire callouts in Hawke’s Bay this Guy Fawkes, Te Mata Peak summit quiet https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/four-fire-callouts-in-hawkes-bay-this-guy-fawkes-te-mata-peak-summit-quiet/JGRCPYB2XRHY7LWFIMZEFC7IGY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/four-fire-callouts-in-hawkes-bay-this-guy-fawkes-te-mata-peak-summit-quiet/JGRCPYB2XRHY7LWFIMZEFC7IGY/ Jack RiddellTe Mata Peak had no issues, with its summit closing early each night this week. Wed, 06 Nov 2024 00:02:59 +0000 A fire at the summit of Te Mata Peak last year. The peak closed to vehicles earlier over the Guy Fawkes period this year to prevent similar fireworks incidents.

Fireworks shot at primary school children in rural West Auckland: Young girl’s clothes burned https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fireworks-shot-at-primary-school-children-in-rural-west-auckland-young-girls-clothes-burned/JGJUOHKS4FDBRE75UDTUQDAZ6U/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fireworks-shot-at-primary-school-children-in-rural-west-auckland-young-girls-clothes-burned/JGJUOHKS4FDBRE75UDTUQDAZ6U/ Raphael FranksThe incident happened on Victory Rd in Laingholm about 4.45pm. Tue, 05 Nov 2024 23:44:37 +0000 A group of 'hooligans' allegedly shot fireworks at a group of primary school-aged children in rural West Auckland. Photo / 123rf
Country’s oldest agricultural show - Bay of Islands P&I Show back this weekend https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/countrys-oldest-agriculture-show-bay-of-islands-pi-show-back-this-weekend/KIOSGX4OKNCRNK6O6IKUGMS6Z4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/countrys-oldest-agriculture-show-bay-of-islands-pi-show-back-this-weekend/KIOSGX4OKNCRNK6O6IKUGMS6Z4/ Mike DinsdaleBay of Islands Pastoral & Industrial Show on this Saturday. Tue, 05 Nov 2024 23:00:00 +0000 There’ll be plenty of entertainment when rural Northland displays itself at Saturday’s Bay of Islands Pastoral & Industrial Show.
Far North starting point for anti-Treaty Principles Bill hīkoi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-starting-point-for-anti-treaty-principles-bill-hikoi/QOHYMWS2SFCOHKL5FY73EE6IIA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-starting-point-for-anti-treaty-principles-bill-hikoi/QOHYMWS2SFCOHKL5FY73EE6IIA/ Mike DinsdaleAnti-Treaty Principles Bill hīkoi starts at Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua on Monday. Tue, 05 Nov 2024 23:00:00 +0000 Dame Whina Cooper inspired a country when she set off on a dusty Far North road for Parliament in September 1975, on her land march. On Sunday a new generation of Māori rights campaigners will set off from Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua. Photo / Frank Habicht
